summary: A March 8, 2021 letter from defense attorney Laura A. Menninger of Haddon, Morgan and Foreman to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, requesting discovery related to FOIA productions in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell. The letter specifically seeks documents the FBI released to Radar Online regarding the investigation of Jeffrey Epstein, details about their release, and information about other FOIA productions. It also challenges the government's prior representation that its prosecution team had no involvement in the Florida investigation, suggesting FBI-New York was involved.

persons.name: Laura A. Menninger
persons.context: Attorney from Haddon, Morgan and Foreman who authored and signed the letter, making discovery requests on behalf of Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in case 20 Cr. 330 (AJN), for whom the defense attorney is requesting discovery materials related to the investigation of her alleged co-conspirator, Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the FBI investigation documents requested; described as Maxwell's alleged co-conspirator. The FOIA release pertained to the investigation and prosecution of Epstein.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The judge to whom the government made a representation on October 7, 2020, regarding the prosecution team's lack of involvement in the Florida investigation.

connections.description: Maxwell is described as the alleged co-conspirator of Jeffrey Epstein in the context of the criminal case.
Menninger, as a defense attorney from Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, is acting as legal counsel for Maxwell, making discovery requests on her behalf.

events.title: Government's Letter to Judge Nathan
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office represented to Judge Nathan that its prosecution team, including the FBI-New York Office, had no involvement in the Florida investigation of Epstein.

events.title: Deadline for Discovery Production
events.description: The defense requests the government provide the requested discovery materials by the end of the week, March 15, 2021.

locations: Southern District of New York, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The defense is requesting all documents (1,232 pages) the FBI in New York released to Radar Online regarding the investigation and prosecution of Jeffrey Epstein, arguing they are relevant to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense.
The defense alleges that public availability of witness statements could lead to witnesses conforming their testimony, making the timing of the FBI's releases to the media materially relevant.

The letter challenges the government's prior statement that its prosecution team had no involvement in the Florida investigation, asserting the FBI-New York Office participated by arranging interviews of New York witnesses between 2005 and 2010.
The document is a formal discovery request made under Federal Rule of Criminal Procedure 16(a)(1)(E) as the case was rapidly approaching trial in March 2021.
